Module com.example.battleship
Package com.example.battleship.Model.Player

Class PlayerAdapter

java.lang.Object
com.example.battleship.Model.Player.PlayerAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPlayer
public abstract class PlayerAdapter extends Object implements IPlayer
Abstract adapter class for IPlayer that provides default implementations of all interface methods by delegating to a wrapped IPlayer instance.

This adapter allows subclasses to override only the methods they need to customize, without being forced to implement all interface methods. This is useful when you want to add behavior (statistics, logging, validation) to only specific player operations.

Since:
1.0
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerAdapter

      public PlayerAdapter(IPlayer player)
      Creates a new PlayerAdapter wrapping the given player instance. The adapter will delegate all method calls to this player unless overridden.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to wrap and adapt
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if player is null

  • Method Details

    • shoot

      public void shoot(int positionX, int positionY)
      Registers a shot made by this player.

      Default implementation delegates to the wrapped player.

      Specified by:
      shoot in interface IPlayer
      Parameters:
      positionX - 1-based column (x) coordinate of the shot
      positionY - 1-based row (y) coordinate of the shot

    • alreadyShot

      public boolean alreadyShot(int x, int y)
      Checks whether this player has already shot at a specific coordinate.

      Default implementation delegates to the wrapped player.

      Specified by:
      alreadyShot in interface IPlayer
      Parameters:
      x - 1-based column coordinate
      y - 1-based row coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the player previously fired at (x, y)

    • isEliminated

      public boolean isEliminated()
      Returns whether the player has been eliminated from the game.

      Default implementation delegates to the wrapped player.

    • getShots

      public List<int[]> getShots()
      Returns the list of shots this player has made. Each shot is represented as an int[] of length 2: {x, y}.

      Default implementation delegates to the wrapped player.

      Specified by:
      getShots in interface IPlayer
      Returns:
      mutable list of shot coordinates

    • getPlayer

      protected IPlayer getPlayer()
      Returns the wrapped IPlayer instance. Useful if you need direct access to the underlying Player object.
      Returns:
      the wrapped IPlayer instance
